Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: First, the task is to apply process mining techniques to infer activities from sensor readings. The activities are like Cutting Metal, Assembling Parts, Welding, Quality Inspection, or Packaging.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Identifying Activities. The task involves using process mining to deduce activities from sensor data. Activities include actions like Cutting Metal, Assembling Parts, Welding, Quality Inspection, and Packaging.

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: Analyzing Sensor Data. Need to group sensor events into phases using patterns in temperature, pressure, vibration, material flow, tool position, and energy. Will assign activity labels based on these patterns and provide rationale for each phase.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Examining Event Log. Events 1-3 show low readings (temp 20-21 C, energy 0.40-0.50 kWh), likely idle or startup phase.

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Event 4 marks a shift with temp at 50 C, vibration at 30 Hz, and energy at 2.00 kWh, indicating activity start.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Events 5-6 suggest cutting or machining with temp 55-58 C, vibration 35-38 Hz, and energy 2.50-3.00 kWh.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Event 7-8 show stable, moderate readings (temp 40 C, pressure 2 bar), possibly a transition phase.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Event 9, with temp at 80 C, vibration at 50 Hz, and energy at 5.00 kWh, suggests welding due to high readings and no flow.
